sentences: Ta ostis endale uue kingituse omale.
context: "Omale" is an Estonian pronoun that means "for oneself," "to oneself," or simply "oneself." It is in the allative case, indicating direction or destination - something being done or going toward oneself. The word emphasizes personal possession or benefit, as opposed to doing something for others. In English translations, it might appear as "for myself/himself/herself/etc." depending on context.
